page.title: 18RAMADAN AND EID IN PRESTON
page.content: We Muslims have a month, called Ramadan, when we don't eat from dawn until dusk because Allah wants us to remember the poor. At sunset we eat dates, fruit, samoosas and vegetables. Later we wake up to have a big meal. After a special prayer, called Niyat, we can't eat any more, so we go back to sleep. At the end of Ramadan, there is a festival called Eid. Ladies decorate their hands with mendi (henna). We all wear new clothes. The men go to the mosque. Later everyone goes visiting. When some one opens the door they say Eid Mubarak (Happy Eid!). We all have plenty to eat and drink.
